title: Majority (Doesn’t) Rule...? Should you be able to win a surrender vote with 3 poeple..?
body:
Why is it that out of a team of 5, where 3 people (the majority) vote to surrender – the surrender vote fails...?
All because 2 people (the minority) have declined to surrender - even though they are usually the two that fed there lanes so badly that everyone else on their team decided to /surrender at 20mins - graciously accepting defeat, realising that continuation of the game was a fruitless task.
To add insult to injury you always have to go through the punishment of reading them say, the always enlightening phrase "DON'T WORRY, WE GOT THIS..." with stats like 0/8/0 (5 mins in - in enemy teams favor) before refusing to surrender (over and over and over again)
I would like for Riot to bring league out of the past and into the present where the Majority Vote Rules & change the voting system so that 3 out of 5 is a surrender…

replies.body:
I have had games where the enemy was attacking our nexus and we were 20 kills down and 3/5 surrendered but the other two didn't Mircale comebacks are fun, especially  when your nexus is 200 health and you ace the enemy team with 70 second death timers and end up winning the game.
#Neversurrender

I have had those games too - heaps of times & hated every one of them... 3 people out of 5 wanted to gg that and had to play on (& carry the other 2) until they won - so the question is simply why should 3 be forced to play for 2..? there are 10 players - 5 want to win and are happy for you to surrender, another 3 want to surrender and go play a good game but because 2 people, 20% of the players (2 out of 10 = 20%) everyone else has to continue the %%%%fight...

This "**Neversurrender**" mentality just means 8 other player have to play on because 2 players want too... 

Also I don't mean to be rude but I think what you meant to say was "DON'T WORRY, WE GOT THIS..."

I see where you are coming from, there have been games where I have actually surrendered because my team is too toxic, or everyone has given up or because it isn't fun anymore (I only play for fun). 

If 3/5 surrender vote was needed to pass a surrender, I doubt many games would actually be played to full time when the nexus exploded. It also ingrains a defeatist attitude in players that can carry over in real life.

That is just your belief - I believe it teaches people to choose there battles wisely - sometimes the only way to win a game is not to play at all.
Gambling addicts never quit, Look at where that mentality takes them.. 
As for people who need a computer game to teach them their life values maybe a game about 5 people KILLING another 5 people is not for them - they should just stick to pokemon - but then again, animal cruelty...?
So true.
Fact is if you can't get 4 people to agree the game is over, it generally isn't over.
If your teamwork is so poor that 5 people are arguing over surrendering the fact is - the game is already over...

No we're saying that 3 People are arguing the game over, if you can't convince the other 2 then the game isn't over.

When the 3 assholes give up, then they should be banned for feeding/doing nothing.
Sometimes 3 people have given up because the 2 others have been feeding/doing nothing but feeding, hence why they want to surrender...
Which means they are tools that should be banned, that doesn't have anything to do with changing the limit to surrenders that has to do with needing a tribunal.

The reality is that that the tribunal cant completely fix this issue only partially regulate it, that's why we need a 3 man surrender or "majority Vote"..

To learn more about tribunal go here:

http://gdcvault.com/play/1017940/The-Science-Behind-Shaping-Player 

You will see they cant actually fix the issue only reduce it..

This has nothing to do with the point that your asking for something that shouldn't be put in, especially considering in at least dozen ranked games i have had 3 man surrender votes, and then won the game rather easily.

It's never going to suit everyone, but majority rules isn't going to make it suit anyone any more then it does now, get the %%%% over it and keep playing.
Lets be perfectly honest here, what you really meant to say was "DON'T WORRY, WE GOT THIS..."
I never surrender ever no matter what even when I myself know I can't win I don't surrender.

You should learn to, because your unreasonable your team mates have to waste their time on a futile task - not to mention a really boring match... You are a perfect example of why we need a 3 man vote, as you have pointed out - you will never surrender
"no matter what even when I myself know I can't win I don't surrender" 
forcing the Majority to play a painful (not fun) game...

It's not difficult for them when there fed and your beaten, they just talk about how badly they smashed you...

The amount of times i've suffered through cry babies trying to surrender and losing the vote 3-2 only to win the game 15 minutes later is quite substantial. Enough games where having a 3-man vote would be a terrible idea.

Never surrender.

No game is 100% over until the Nexus explodes. You never know, maybe lightning strikes and all 5 enemies dc... you never know.

i think when 3 say yes 1 no and 1 abstain that most definetly should be a surrender

> [{quoted}](name=jigglejigglwoosh,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=sgAdtEtx,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2015-01-24T02:58:25.701+0000)
>
> i think when 3 say yes 1 no **and 1 abstain that most definetly should be a surrender**

I am against this because I (like a few) move the surrender off the screen because I don't want to have to answer this annoying/distracting pop up every 5 minutes.
If the rest of the team are trying to surrender every five minutes there may be a reason for it. One option to not have to keep ignoring this "annoying/distracting pop up" is to click yes..
Well if abstains weren't counted then that would happen, since it's actually 75% needed for surrender, but Riot counts abstains as no for some reason.
"Abstains" don't contend but still get countered as a no - if the person does not contest the surrender it should be counted as a yes, this would fix the issue in some games..
"Abstains" should count as abstains, that's what they're called after all.
yet they count as a no...

Because they are essentially no's in any case, i have a few times let the timer run down to see if i feel from the next fight we end up being stomped (being the deciding vote) and it comes down to the fact that the vote was called to early to actually tell if we are in a losing position.

EDIT: if there was an actual abstain button this would be different.

If you refer to the scenario I quoted it said "with stats like 0/8/0 (5 mins in - in enemy teams favor)"
If you still need time to figure out your loosing...

If you really want to surrender, and two people keep saying no, and the game drags on for another 10 minutes, then the game wasn't really over when you wanted to surrender. Unless the enemy just aced you with 70 second death timers and they are charging at your nexus, there is no reason to surrender, particularly in something like a ranked game. The entire basis for your argument is purely anecdotal.

You say that the two people who say no are the ones who feed. I am often stuck with 3 people who were doing badly and two people carrying who refuse to surrender, should they be punished because their team is playing badly and being salty?

LOL Anecdotal... I apologise that my opinions are based on observations rather than rigorous scientific analysis, I didn't realise I required a PHD and scientific lab results to put forth a vote, about an opinion of mine on a computer game forum.. You are indeed right - by definition it is anecdotal and your not just being facetious...

As for your second paragraph which also has no scientific analysis to back it and therefor is also anecdotal, the biggest issue is that the two who think they are "carrying" are more often then not the problem...

The point of my second paragraph was to demonstrate that anecdotal evidence is insufficient to make those sorts of claims.

Also Facetious means taking something that is normally serious in a lighthearted manner. I don't believe that is what you meant to say there.

fa•ce•tious (fə-sēˈshəs)

    adj.
    Playfully jocular; humorous: facetious remarks.

I was being facetious in response to your wording... I meant to use it... 

So your aware anyone can type define into a search and get the meaning of any word now and don't require your assistance - however i do appreciate your passion for education..

As for your second paragraph pointing out that anecdotal evidence is insufficient to make "those sort of claims" I did not accuse anyone of murder in a court of law. I simply put forth my opinion, in relation to my experience in playing a game I enjoy & used the powers entrusted in me (& all of us) by riot, to put it to a vote. I require no evidence to have an opinion, as I in relation to the topic of my opinion - I am the one and only expert, in the subject of my opinion I would be considered and expert and therefore anything I say in relation to my opinion is hardly anecdotal as I am an expert on myself.

You are welcome to vote against..

Sorry, but I'd be more inclined to vote for changing it to a unanimous 5 player vote.  I feeking hate it when the game is not lost and my 4 moron teammates surrender on me.  It happens far too often for my liking.

Example: A couple of nights ago, at the 21min mark, kills were 14-17 against us.   The enemy Akali had 7 kills.  My 4 teammates surrender, leaving me sitting thinking wtf.  A totally winnable game, but 4 idiots just ended up wasting 21 mins of my life because they were all quiters.  

No thanks.  There's no way I'd agree to making it even easier for quitter-losers to surrender games.

Ok so you figured it was an easy match with your skills and for them it was impossible to win their lanes/matchups. 

And so because the 4 of them figured 'why bother with this' and went to play a new game that wasn't so lop-sided you consider that wasting YOUR time?

Your preference would be to spend another 15-20mins playing a game where each of them were probably going to lose lane and rely on you carrying up until the point the enemy team destroys you specifically and then its just an easy ace away from them pillaging the nexus.

That's a the better option? 4 people suffering a terrible match barely scraping by because you figure you can carry it?

God that's the most horrific, self-centered logic I've had the misfortune of contemplating.
Arrow pointing at what he said ------>    ^

Someone is not a quitter or looser for surrendering - there just smart enough to know when there beaten or simply not having fun, is it worse to waste 21 mins of 1 persons life or 45 mins of 4 peoples life..?

You say it happens far to often maybe you are the common denominator in this situation - I don't mean to attack you but if 4 people say its over and 1 says its not odds are against you being right - on top of it, you yourself talk about how often it happens, further indicating that you may be the course of this issue.

when I'm singed and i've seen farming furiously for the last 20 minutes, not even it my prime yet against a team of shaco's and leblancs and renektons and other useless(ish) champs that I know are not going to be able to perform in teamfights. just to instantly start getting surr votes, it really annoys me. if they cannot end the game being fed in the next 5 minutes it will be gg for them.
Some people do that but this is a vote about surrendering requiring 3 out of 5 - NOT people surrendering to early or for no good reason...
You do know there is a thing called comebacks.....
Yes - these are not the scenarios to which I refer…
